articles.headline: Offering Inspiration and Advice, Real Vision Is HGTV for Hedge Fund Hopefuls
articles.snippet: With some 20,000 devotees, a start-up financial video service sells the strategies of insiders, with a side of lifestyle television.
articles.abstract: With some 20,000 devotees, a start-up financial video service sells the strategies of insiders, with a side of lifestyle television.
articles.lead_paragraph: Kieran O’Dea rises at 5 a.m. to begin his daily routine, shuffling to his desk to eye his portfolio: a cluster of biotechnology stocks and a bet that Tesla will go bust.

articles.headline: Trump Engaged in Suspect Tax Schemes as He Reaped Riches From His Father
articles.snippet: The president has long sold himself as a self-made billionaire, but a Times investigation found that he received at least $413 million in today’s dollars from his father’s real estate empire, much of it through tax dodges in the 1990s.
articles.abstract: The president has long sold himself as a self-made billionaire, but a Times investigation found that he received at least $413 million in today’s dollars from his father’s real estate empire, much of it through tax dodges in the 1990s.
articles.lead_paragraph: The president has long sold himself as a self-made billionaire, but a Times investigation found that he received at least $413 million in today’s dollars from his father’s real estate empire, much of it through tax dodges in the 1990s.
articles.byline: By David Barstow, Susanne Craig and Russ Buettner

articles.headline: Facebook Hack Puts Thousands of Other Sites at Risk
articles.snippet: Ten years ago, the social network introduced a password system that connected it to a broad swath of the internet. Now we are seeing the downside.
articles.abstract: Ten years ago, the social network introduced a password system that connected it to a broad swath of the internet. Now we are seeing the downside.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When Mark Zuckerberg introduced an online tool called Facebook Connect in 2008, he hailed it as a kind of digital passport to the rest of the internet. In just a few clicks, users would be able to log in to other apps and sites with their Facebook passwords.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and Kate Conger

articles.headline: Elon Musk’s Ultimatum to Tesla: Fight the S.E.C., or I Quit
articles.snippet: Tesla’s board caved to the company co-founder’s demand, according to people familiar with the board’s decision. Two days later, the company and Mr. Musk settled with regulators.
articles.abstract: Tesla’s board caved to the company co-founder’s demand, according to people familiar with the board’s decision. Two days later, the company and Mr. Musk settled with regulators.
articles.lead_paragraph: Securities and Exchange Commission officials were understandably taken aback on Thursday morning when Tesla’s board — and its chairman, Elon Musk — abruptly pulled out of a carefully crafted settlement.

articles.headline: ‘Better to Drown’: A Greek Refugee Camp’s Epidemic of Misery
articles.snippet: Trauma, psychosis and suicide attempts have become common occurrences at Moria, a Greek island camp, where aid groups warn of a mental health crisis.
articles.abstract: Trauma, psychosis and suicide attempts have become common occurrences at Moria, a Greek island camp, where aid groups warn of a mental health crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: MORIA, Greece — He survived torture in Congo, and a perilous boat journey from Turkey. But Michael Tamba, a former Congolese political prisoner, came closest to death only after he had supposedly found sanctuary at Europe’s biggest refugee camp.

articles.headline: Marks & Spencer Is Struggling. Can Knickers, Candy and Colin the Caterpillar Cakes Save It?
articles.snippet: The British icon has played a crucial role in the daily lives of millions for more than 100 years, but financial problems and store closings have made its future uncertain.
articles.abstract: The British icon has played a crucial role in the daily lives of millions for more than 100 years, but financial problems and store closings have made its future uncertain.
articles.lead_paragraph: STOCKTON-ON-TEES, England — This once-booming County Durham market town in the northeast corner of England has something of a grand past. Known for a time as the Queen of the North, Stockton was the departure point in 1825 for the world’s first public passenger railway.
